result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KEVIN M SALM

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Defendant KEVIN M SALM in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Prior to going on the record the defendant stated he is looking for getting an attorney. Defendant concurs. Defendant states he needs 90 days. Further statement by the defendant.

Court adjourned at 1:47 PM

Court sets for Status of Counsel on January 10, 2023 at 1:30 PM
Second appearance scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Second appearance on January 10, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

3:53 PM Defendant KEVIN M SALM in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he'd like to meet with the DA. Statement by the defendant - does not want an attorney. Defendant states he will waive the time limits for the prelim but doesn't want to waive his right to an attorney. Defendant states he'll record every conversation he has in this building. DA Laspisa objects to being recorded. Court states he'll appoint stand-by counsel for the defendant.  Court sets status of counsel October 31, 2022 at 1:45 PM.

Court adjourned at 3:58 PM

Second appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Second appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

No Contact with the children or the mother of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. On 07/26/2022 Court amends bond to: Defendant can have contact with Cole S. Defendant is not to possess any firearms. On 09/06/2022 Court amends bond to: Defendant can have contact with Rylee S.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

No Contact with the children or the mother of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. On 07/26/2022 Court amends bond to: Defendant can have contact with Cole S. Defendant is not to possess any firearms. On 09/06/2022 Court amends bond to: Defendant can have contact with Rylee S.

10:29 AM Defendant KEVIN M SALM in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Before going on the record the defendant stated he has not committed a crime and does not need an attorney at this time. Defendant concurs. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Statement by ADA McElroy. Defendant's daughter RS is present and requests contact with defendant, Court amends bond to allow contact with Rylee S. Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:35 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement

No Contact with the children or the mother of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. On 07/26/2022 Court amends bond to: Defendant can have contact with Cole S. Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No Contact with the children or the mother of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. On 07/26/2022 Court amends bond to: Defendant can have contact with Cole S. Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

9:37 AM Defendant KEVIN M SALM in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes bond has been set. ADA makes statement regarding bond. Statement by Cole, and requests to go back home with defendant. Statement by ADA regarding bond. Court orders a condition of bond - Defendant can have contact with Cole S. Defendant is not to possess any firearms. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:41 AM
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
**PROCESSING NEEDED**

No Contact with the children or the mother of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
Letter to the poster of the bond dated 07/18/2022 re: cash bond posted and form to be filled out and returned

No Contact with the children or the mother of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:06 PM Defendant Kevin M. Salm in court, in custody and via video.  Attorney Michael Kapelis present in court. Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $2,500 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the children or the other of the children. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Court sets for Initial Appearance on July 26, 2022 at 9:30 AM. Further statement by the court, if defendant is still in custody, court will re-address bond.

Court adjourned at 1:12 PM
